{{also|Appendix:Variations of "mai"}} ==English== ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{given name|en|female}}, a rare spelling variant of [[Mae]]/[[May]], or borrowed from Scandinavia, with the same ultimate origin. # {{surname|en|from=Chinese|dot=}} of Chinese or German origin. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=aim|AIM|AMI|I am|I'm a|I'm a'|I'm'a|I'ma|IAM|Ima|Ima'|MIA|Mia|aim|i'm'a|i'ma|ima|mia}} [[Category:English surnames from German]] ---- ==Danish== ===Proper noun=== {{head|da|proper noun}} # {{given name|da|female|var=Maj}}. ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== Short form of [[Maia]], from [[Maarja]] / [[Maria]]; also associated with the month {{m|et|mai||May}}. ===Proper noun=== {{head|et|proper noun}} # {{given name|et|female}}. ---- ==Ewe== ===Proper noun=== {{head|ee|proper noun}} # [[May]] (month) ====Related terms==== * {{l|ee|Damɛ}} [[Category:ee:Months]] ---- ==Friulian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|fur|la|māius}}. ===Noun=== {{head|fur|noun}} # [[May]] [[Category:fur:Months]] ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/maɪ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Mai.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Mais|gen2=Mai|Maie}} # [[May]] (month) ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|e}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Maibaum}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Months]] ---- ==Japanese== ===Romanization=== {{ja-romaji}} # {{ja-romanization of|まい}} ---- ==Norwegian== ===Proper noun=== {{head|no|proper noun}} # {{given name|no|female}}, short for [[Maja]], [[Maria]], or from the month. ---- ==Vietnamese== ===Etymology=== {{vi-etym-sino|梅}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{vi-IPA}} * {{hmp|vi|mai}} ===Proper noun=== {{vi-propn|head=[[mai|Mai]]}} # {{surname|vi|from=Chinese}} # {{given name|vi|female|from=Chinese}} ---- ==Welsh== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|cy|la|Māius}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|cy|/mai̯/}} * {{audio|cy|Cy-Mai.ogg|Audio}} ===Proper noun=== {{cy-proper noun|m}} # {{l|en|May}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|cy|cyntefin}} ===See also=== * {{list:Gregorian calendar months/cy}}
